alert.note: Alert for Lake (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 22 at 12:19PM MDT until September 22 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Rock slides and runoff are occurring due to excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Montana, including the following county, Lake. This includes the following Specific Areas... Boulder 2700 Fire Burn Area near Flathead Lake. * WHEN...Until 615 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Additional runoff impacting Highway 35 is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1216 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly on Highway 35 near the Boulder 2700 Burn Scare. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
